p: The Mar Menor catchment is intensely managed and only about one third of the total inflow to the lagoon is generated naturally (Stefanova et al. 2015). Consequently, the combined impacts do not differ much from the socio-economic impacts. The assumed changes in released water from the UWWTP and the extent of irrigated agricultural area are well reflected by the variations in the four variables. Q 90 and Q 50 respond slightly more sensitively to these changes than Q 10 and Q av, which is due to their dependency on infiltrated irrigation water and continuous input of water from the UWWTP. In contrast, changes in Q 10 and Q av are intensified or reversed some scenarios when climate change is added to the socio-economic impacts.
